p: Three of the most important climatic determinants of global vegetation patterns are minimum temperature, growing season and water balance ( Prentice et al., 1992; Normand, Svenning & Skov, 2007). We therefore selected these three variables to model occurrence patterns of ragweed over the next century: growing degree days (GDD), absolute minimum temperature of the coldest month ( T min) and water balance (WBAL) (for further information on the climatic variables see Appendix S1). We used two IPCC AR5 climate change scenarios, including a high-end (RCP 8.5) and a moderate (RCP 6.0) climate change scenario, to represent future climate conditions by year 2100 (projection period 2070â€“2099).
